keyTakeAways: Prince Andrew allegedly asked a bodyguard officer to investigate Virginia Giuffre’s criminal record in 2011, raising concerns about the use of a close protection officer in a smear campaign.
Giuffre, a sexual assault accuser and former victim of Epstein, died by suicide in April 2025, adding a personal and tragic dimension to the allegations.
Andrew claimed in 2022 to have settled a civil suit with Giuffre, admitting to her suffering as a victim of sex trafficking but denying any wrongdoing.
The revelation of Andrew’s emails with Epstein from February 28, 2011, where he stated they were 'in this together,' contradicted prior denials and reignited public outrage.
British Energy Secretary Ed Miliband condemned the idea of using police officers for smear operations, emphasizing ethical and professional boundaries.
The House of Windsor has been under sustained criticism for years due to Andrew’s ties to Epstein and his denial of sexual encounters with Giuffre, leading to his demotion and title relinquishment.
Giuffre’s family supported Andrew’s title relinquishment but urged King Charles III to strip the title entirely, reflecting deep public and familial dissatisfaction.

summaryOfNewsArticle: London police are investigating whether Prince Andrew, in 2011, asked a bodyguard officer to dig up dirt on Virginia Giuffre, a woman who accused him of sexual assault and was a victim of Jeffrey Epstein’s trafficking network. The investigation stems from media reports and the release of emails showing Andrew’s continued contact with Epstein, including a note from February 28, 2011, where he said they were 'in this together.' Giuffre, who died by suicide in April 2025, had no criminal record, and her family welcomed Andrew’s relinquishment of titles but urged King Charles III to fully strip his title. Andrew settled a civil suit with Giuffre in 2022, acknowledging her suffering but denying wrongdoing. British Energy Secretary Ed Miliband condemned the use of a close protection officer in a smear campaign, stating such actions are unacceptable. The scandal has deepened public distrust in the monarchy and reignited years of criticism over Andrew’s ties to Epstein and lack of empathy for victims.
title: Police looking into whether Prince Andrew enlisted officer to dig up dirt on accuser Giuffre
